alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Licking; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD, NORTHEASTERN PICKAWAY AND SOUTHWESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Grove City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Pickerington, Pataskala, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Ashville, Baltimore, South Bloomfield, Etna, Obetz, Commercial Point, Lithopolis, Carroll, Harrisburg, Orient, Lockbourne, Brice and Blacklick Estates. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 106 and 119. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 93 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
